body:
### Problem

Crash with some flavor of heap corruption/double free. Managed to bisect it down to d909de2d.

### Steps to reproduce

I don't have a clean reproduction, but I isolated it to a case with noice and blink.cmp when tabbing through files with long names when doing `:e`.

What seems to happen is that the file name is long enough to go outside the box that noice uses which triggers the crash very shortly after.

I managed to get address sanitizer to complain once when run at head (iirc), not sure if it's helpful, but it's something.

<details>
  <summary>asan dump</summary>

```
  =================================================================
==2617220==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: heap-buffer-overflow on address 0x5110002ba830 at pc 0x561db0dded53 bp 0x7ffc549650e0 sp 0x7ffc549650d8
READ of size 4 at 0x5110002ba830 thread T0
    #0 0x561db0dded52 in grid_put_linebuf <redacted>/neovim/src/nvim/grid.c:793:9
    #1 0x561db08dda1f in wlv_put_linebuf <redacted>/neovim/src/nvim/drawline.c:3222:3
    #2 0x561db08d16a3 in win_line <redacted>/neovim/src/nvim/drawline.c:3113:7
    #3 0x561db090e5bd in win_update <redacted>/neovim/src/nvim/drawscreen.c:2202:15

    #20 0x561db175a085 in state_enter <redacted>/neovim/src/nvim/state.c:100:26

allocated by thread T0 here:
    #0 0x561db049bdc3 in malloc (<redacted>/neovim/build/bin/nvim+0xd44dc3) (BuildId: 89d77c380db923f64eff028290d01a96b8be01ce)

SUMMARY: AddressSanitizer: heap-buffer-overflow <redacted>/neovim/src/nvim/grid.c:793:9 in grid_put_linebuf
Shadow bytes around the buggy address:
  0x5110002ba580: fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fa fa fa fa fa fa fa fa
  0x5110002ba600: fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd
  0x5110002ba680: fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd
  0x5110002ba700: fa fa fa fa fa fa fa fa 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00
  0x5110002ba780: 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00
=>0x5110002ba800: 00 00 00 00 00 00[fa]fa fa fa fa fa fa fa fa fa
  0x5110002ba880: 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00
  0x5110002ba900: 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 fa fa
  0x5110002ba980: fa fa fa fa fa fa fa fa 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00
  0x5110002baa00: 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00
  0x5110002baa80: 00 00 00 00 00 00 fa fa fa fa fa fa fa fa fa fa
Shadow byte legend (one shadow byte represents 8 application bytes):
  Addressable:           00
  Partially addressable: 01 02 03 04 05 06 07 
  Heap left redzone:       fa
  Freed heap region:       fd
  Stack left redzone:      f1
  Stack mid redzone:       f2
  Stack right redzone:     f3
  Stack after return:      f5
  Stack use after scope:   f8
  Global redzone:          f9

  Poisoned by user:        f7
  Container overflow:      fc
  Array cookie:            ac
  Intra object redzone:    bb
  ASan internal:           fe
  Left alloca redzone:     ca
  Right alloca redzone:    cb
==2617220==ABORTING
```

</details>

I will try to reproduce it in a clean(er) setup on my personal machine.

### Expected behavior

No crash.

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

0.12.0-dev commit d909de2d onwards

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

N/A

### Operating system/version

Linux

### Terminal name/version

Ghostty 1.2.1-dev

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-ghostty

### Installation

Built from repo

comment_data.body:
Is lazy actually required for the repro, or can you just use `vim.pack` (Nvim 0.12 feature):

```lua
vim.pack.add{ 'https://github.com/MunifTanjim/nui.nvim' }
```
Probably not, I just haven't moved my config to that. Let me try to have a repro using that

This crash is quite far removed from the bisected commit. It happens because the noice window is resized inside during an `on_line` decor provider callback, which creates a mismatch between the window and grid size. Repeated <kbd>Ctrl-L</kbd> presses with the following init.lua will reproduce the crash:

```lua
local width = 1
local win = vim.api.nvim_open_win(0, false, { bufpos = {0, 1}, relative = 'win', width = 1, height = 1})
vim.api.nvim_set_decoration_provider(1, {
  on_line = function()
    width = width + 1
    vim.api.nvim_win_set_width(win, width)
  end
})
```

`nvim_set_decoration_provider()` is already documented to only be expected to work with `nvim_buf_set_extmark()` calls, so not sure if the actual crash here requires fixing.

Even so I think an alternative to d909de2 could be to avoid flushing UI callbacks during textlock (assuming it is already postponed to later the same/next event loop cycle, which I think is a fair assumption). That seems to avoid the crash and the original error from #36240.

labels.description: issue has been tracked to a specific commit
labels.name: has:bisected

labels.description: Nvim 0.12 mesages/dialog/pager/notifications based on the UI-ext protocol
labels.name: ui2

title: vim.ui_attach: heap corruption crash after commit d909de2d
